International Student Support Center                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                                                                                 Student Life/Services             Graduate Student Life Undergraduate Student Life International Students International Student Support Center  NYU Services & Resources                   Career                 Community             Councils Clubs Community Service                   New Students             Getting Started Frequently Asked Questions Immunization                   Policies                 Events                 Noncredit Students                                                   International Student Support Center                                            International Students ›                International Student Support Center                 About          Cultural and Social Programs          Academic Enhancement Programs                                      More Links           American Language Institute        NYU Office of Residential Life and Housing Services        NYU Wasserman Center for Career Development        You@NYU                                                                                               Welcome International Students                                                        International Student Support Center                                                              Play                           The International Student Support Center (ISSC) provides support to international students to help them succeed in their NYU School of Professional Studies graduate and undergraduate classes and to adjust to life in New York City. A dedicated team of staff members offers students assistance in acquiring the linguistic, academic, and intercultural capability necessary to excel during their time at the School and beyond.         International Student Support Center Lounge   The ISSC lounge is open to all NYU School of Professional Studies students and is a place where intercultural exchange and cooperation are encouraged. Students are urged to engage with each other to increase their understanding of the global interconnectedness of society and how it permeates throughout their study, their careers, and their lives.   New Students   Browse these helpful links to learn more about the ISSC, and the University's and School's events and activities for new students.       Orientation to the ISSC and NYC     NYU Fall 2014 Welcome Week *             Visit Us   Address : NYU Midtown Center   11 W 42nd Street, Room 1009   New York, NY 10003   Hours : Mon., Wed., & Fri., 10 a.m.–6 p.m.   Tues. & Thurs., 10a.m.–7 p.m. (8 p.m. during finals)   Summer & Intersession: Mon.-Fri., 10 a.m.–5 p.m.   Walk-ins are welcome anytime during these hours.   Phone : (212) 992-3208            * The next NYU Welcome Week will be held in Fall 2015. Global Leadership Scholars Program                                                                   Contact Us      New York University's Office of Global Programs consists of two administrative offices in New York and 11 Global Academic Centers in: Accra, Berlin, Buenos Aires, Florence, London, Madrid, Paris, Prague, Sydney, Tel Aviv, and Washington, DC.   The New York Offices answer general questions about admissions, operations, academics and preparing to go abroad. Site representatives are available in New York to answer questions about all academic centers abroad. Other NYU departments answer questions about billing, student health matters, and financial assistance.              To report a student emergency at any NYU location in the world, call NYU's Department of Public Safety at (US 001) 212-998-2222, (24 hours).
